name: Jitsu
description: Jitsu is a real-time data collection platform. Deployment guide: https://jitsu.com/docs/deployment/deploy-on-heroku. More about Jitsu: https://jitus.com

GEO_MAXMIND_PATH.description: (Optional) If you want Jitsu to resolve location-based data (Coutry, City, etc) based on IP address, provide HTTP URL to hosted Maxmind DB file. You can leave it blank, it this case location-resolution wont' work. See https://jitsu.com/docs/other-features/geo-data-resolution for details

SMTP_HOST.description: (Optional) For using reset/forgot password feature - configure SMTP Host for sending emails.

SMTP_PORT.description: (Optional) For using reset/forgot password feature - configure SMTP Port for sending emails.

SMTP_USER.description: (Optional) For using reset/forgot password feature - configure SMTP User for sending emails.

SMTP_PASSWORD.description: (Optional) For using reset/forgot password feature - configure SMTP Password for sending emails.

CONFIGURATOR_ADMIN_TOKEN.description: Token for communication between Jitsu internal services (Configurator and Server). Leave it autogenerated unless you know what you do

SERVER_ADMIN_TOKEN.description: Admin token for managing Jitsu through diagnostics HTTP API (https://jitsu.com/docs/other-features/admin-endpoints). You can leave it autogenerated, but on each server restart you'll need to update your HTTP scripts (if you have any). The value can be any random string number

UI_AUTH_ACCESS_SECRET.description: Secret token to run auth. You can leave it autogenerated, but login sessions won't persist between app restart. (Tech details: Jitsu auth is based on JWT, this is JWT access secret)

UI_AUTH_REFRESH_SECRET.description: Secret token to run auth. You can leave it autogenerated, but login sessions won't persist between app restart. (Tech details: Jitsu auth is based on JWT, this is JWT refresh secret)

ENVIRONMENT.description: Deployment environment. Leave it unless you know what you do

TLS_SKIP_VERIFY.description: Heroku Redis requires TLS_SKIP_VERIFY=true. Leave it unless you know what you do

SERVER_CONFIGURATOR_REDIRECT_HTTPS.description: Heroku deployments requires SERVER_CONFIGURATOR_REDIRECT_HTTPS=true. Leave it unless you know what you do
